snippet: Some officials are concerned that a verdict against the bank, which is accused of maintaining an account for Hamas, could mean that doing business in many areas of the world may become too risky.
abstract: Basic bank account at Arab Bank's Al Mazra branch in Beirut, Lebanon, is at center of first civil trial against a bank under Anti-Terrorism Act; account is in name of Osama Hamdan, a spokesman for Hamas, and suit charges that account and ones like it make up critical financial infrastructure for terrorist networks; suit was filed in Federal District Court in Brooklyn by 279 plaintiffs who represent victims of Hamas attacks.

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

lead_paragraph: Some officials are concerned that a verdict against the bank, which is accused of maintaining an account for Hamas, could mean that doing business in many areas of the world may become too risky.

headline.main: Terrorism Trial of Mideast Bank Worries the Financial World
headline.print_headline: Terrorism Trial of Mideast Bank Worries the Financial World
